FileSystemHandleRemove.summary: The remove() method of the interface requests removal of the entry represented by the handle from the underlying file system.

remarks.para: The remove() method allows you to remove a file or directory directly from its handle. Without this method, you would have to obtain the handle of the parent directory, then call on that to remove it.
You can also call remove() on the root directory of the Origin Private File System to clear its contents, after which a new empty OPFS is created.

FileSystemHandleRemove.returns: A that fulfills with a value of undefined.
